message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with action recognition in videos, which is a common problem in computer vision. The approach proposed in the paper is based on learning video representations directly from raw video data, without the need for feature extraction. This is a topic that falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also introduces a new method for learning video representations using discriminative Waldboost, which is a machine learning technique. This suggests that the paper could also be relevant to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper evaluates the proposed approach on a standard action recognition dataset, which falls under the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper could also be relevant to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category, as action recognition is a common task in video search and retrieval.
